H0.text: The motion of the molecules stops when heat energy is added to magnesium fluoride (MgF₂), the product of the reaction between grayish‑white magnesium metal and greenish‑yellow fluorine gas.

H1.text: The motion of the molecules increases when heat energy is added to magnesium fluoride (MgF₂).

H2.text: The motion of the magnesium fluoride (MgF₂) molecules decreases when heat energy is added, even though magnesium metal is grayish‑white and reacts actively with water, fluorine (F₂) is a greenish‑yellow halogen gas at room temperature, and the MgF₂ produced is commonly used in making windows and lenses.

H3.text: The motion of magnesium fluoride (MgF₂) molecules is at a constant rate when heat energy is added.

A4.text: The energy added to the system per gas particle kinetic degree of freedom is K/N D = 1/2 k_B T.
